ingredients: 1 large yellow or white onion, finely chopped (about 2 cups)
2 medium carrots, peeled and finely chopped (optional)
2 pounds Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes (about 5 cups)
steps: In a large pot, melt butter over medium. Add onion (and optional carrots and celery, if using), season with salt and pepper, and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened but not browned, 8 to 10 minutes. Add garlic and stir until fragrant, 1 minute.

Add broth (use 6 cups if including carrots and celery, 5 cups otherwise), potatoes and bay leaf; season with salt, and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cover, adjust heat to medium-low and cook at a gentle simmer until potatoes are completely tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Discard bay leaf.

Working in two batches, if necessary, transfer soup to a blender and pur√©e just until smooth. (Resist the urge to overprocess in the blender, which can result in gummy soup.) Return soup to the pot or, for an extra-silky soup, strain through a fine-mesh sieve into the pot.
Stir in cream and warm over medium-low heat, stirring frequently, for about 2 minutes. Season with salt.
Divide soup among bowls and garnish with chives. Serve warm, with crusty bread.
title: Potato Vegetable Soup
